title: Re: Jump skills
content:
Whoaly garg, that's awesome! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] Never knew one could even pogo that high! Neat!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Jump skills
content:
Yes [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
That's neat...Does anybody know where to find pogosticks?

title: Re: Jump skills
content:
You can order MANY pogosticks online. Besides that... they are actually quite common. Pogosticks are labled as "toys" so you will probably have to suffer the indignity of browsing the isle that also has the "Power Rangers Thunderclap Stomp Sword."

Your best bet would be to look in all the big superstores first. (Boscovs, Sears, etc.) If you can't find one there, you might want to try specialized kids stores like Toys R Us. (For which you would pay $67 USD for a lego set that consists of 20 pieces... But I digress.)

Or you can get one where my parents did. I think they found it in a house they cleaned out in Lancaster city once... It was real rusty and didn't bounce well.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Jump skills
content:

Now, I only have to wait and see...
